distribution.name: owid-covid-data.csv
distribution.description:
### COVID-19 dataset by Our World in Data

▶ Visit their GitHub [here](https://github.com/owid/covid-19-data/tree/master/public/data) 
▶ Our World in Data website [here](https://ourworldindata.org/explorers/coronavirus-data-explorer)

field.name: iso_code
field.description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 – three-letter country codes

field.name: continent
field.description: Continent of the geographical location

field.name: location
field.description: Geographical location

field.name: date
field.description: Date of observation

field.name: total_cases
field.description: Total confirmed cases of COVID-19

field.name: new_cases
field.description: New confirmed cases of COVID-19

field.name: new_cases_smoothed
field.description: New confirmed cases of COVID-19 (7-day smoothed)

field.name: total_deaths
field.description: Total deaths attributed to COVID-19

field.name: new_deaths
field.description: New deaths attributed to COVID-19

field.name: new_deaths_smoothed
field.description: New deaths attributed to COVID-19 (7-day smoothed)

field.name: total_cases_per_million
field.description: Total confirmed cases of COVID-19 per 1,000,000 people

field.name: new_cases_per_million
field.description: New confirmed cases of COVID-19 per 1,000,000 people

field.name: new_cases_smoothed_per_million
field.description: New confirmed cases of COVID-19 (7-day smoothed) per 1,000,000 people

field.name: total_deaths_per_million
field.description: Total deaths attributed to COVID-19 per 1,000,000 people

field.name: new_deaths_per_million
field.description: New deaths attributed to COVID-19 per 1,000,000 people

field.name: new_deaths_smoothed_per_million
field.description: New deaths attributed to COVID-19 (7-day smoothed) per 1,000,000 people

field.name: reproduction_rate
field.description:
Real-time estimate of the effective reproduction rate (R) of COVID-19.
See https://github.com/crondonm/TrackingR/tree/main/Estimates-Database

field.name: icu_patients
field.description: Number of COVID-19 patients in intensive care units (ICUs) on a given day

field.name: icu_patients_per_million
field.description: Number of COVID-19 patients in intensive care units (ICUs) on a given day per 1,000,000 people

field.name: hosp_patients
field.description: Number of COVID-19 patients in hospital on a given day

field.name: hosp_patients_per_million
field.description: Number of COVID-19 patients in hospital on a given day per 1,000,000 people

field.name: weekly_icu_admissions
field.description: Number of COVID-19 patients newly admitted to intensive care units (ICUs) in a given week

field.name: weekly_icu_admissions_per_million
field.description: Number of COVID-19 patients newly admitted to intensive care units (ICUs) in a given week per 1,000,000 people

field.name: weekly_hosp_admissions
field.description: Number of COVID-19 patients newly admitted to hospitals in a given week

field.name: weekly_hosp_admissions_per_million
field.description: Number of COVID-19 patients newly admitted to hospitals in a given week per 1,000,000 people

field.name: total_tests
field.description: New tests for COVID-19 (only calculated for consecutive days)

field.name: new_tests
field.description: Total tests for COVID-19

field.name: total_tests_per_thousand
field.description: Total tests for COVID-19 per 1,000 people

field.name: new_tests_per_thousand
field.description: New tests for COVID-19 per 1,000 people

field.name: new_tests_smoothed
field.description: New tests for COVID-19 (7-day smoothed). For countries that don't report testing data on a daily basis, we assume that testing changed equally on a daily basis over any periods in which no data was reported. This produces a complete series of daily figures, which is then averaged over a rolling 7-day window

field.name: new_tests_smoothed_per_thousand
field.description: New tests for COVID-19 (7-day smoothed) per 1,000 people

field.name: positive_rate
field.description: The share of COVID-19 tests that are positive, given as a rolling 7-day average (this is the inverse of tests_per_case)

field.name: tests_per_case
field.description: Tests conducted per new confirmed case of COVID-19, given as a rolling 7-day average (this is the inverse of positive_rate)

field.name: tests_units
field.description: Units used by the location to report its testing data

field.name: total_vaccinations
field.description: Total number of COVID-19 vaccination doses administered

field.name: people_vaccinated
field.description: Total number of people who received at least one vaccine dose

field.name: people_fully_vaccinated
field.description: Total number of people who received all doses prescribed by the vaccination protocol

field.name: total_boosters
field.description: Total number of COVID-19 vaccination booster doses administered (doses administered beyond the number prescribed by the vaccination protocol)

field.name: new_vaccinations_smoothed
field.description: New COVID-19 vaccination doses administered (only calculated for consecutive days)

field.name: total_vaccinations_per_hundred
field.description: Total number of COVID-19 vaccination doses administered per 100 people in the total population

field.name: people_vaccinated_per_hundred
field.description: Total number of people who received at least one vaccine dose per 100 people in the total population

field.name: people_fully_vaccinated_per_hundred
field.description: Total number of people who received all doses prescribed by the vaccination protocol per 100 people in the total population

field.name: total_boosters_per_hundred
field.description: Total number of COVID-19 vaccination booster doses administered per 100 people in the total population

field.name: new_vaccinations_smoothed_per_million
field.description: New COVID-19 vaccination doses administered (7-day smoothed) per 1,000,000 people in the total population

field.name: new_people_vaccinated_smoothed
field.description: Daily number of people receiving their first vaccine dose (7-day smoothed)

field.name: new_people_vaccinated_smoothed_per_hundred
field.description: Daily number of people receiving their first vaccine dose (7-day smoothed) per 100 people in the total population

field.name: stringency_index
field.description: Government Response Stringency Index: composite measure based on 9 response indicators including school closures, workplace closures, and travel bans, rescaled to a value from 0 to 100 (100 = strictest response)

field.name: population_density
field.description: Population (latest available values). See https://github.com/owid/covid-19-data/blob/master/scripts/input/un/population_latest.csv for full list of sources

field.name: median_age
field.description: Number of people divided by land area, measured in square kilometers, most recent year available

field.name: aged_65_older
field.description: Median age of the population, UN projection for 2020

field.name: aged_70_older
field.description: Share of the population that is 65 years and older, most recent year available

field.name: gdp_per_capita
field.description: Share of the population that is 70 years and older in 2015

field.name: extreme_poverty
field.description: Gross domestic product at purchasing power parity (constant 2011 international dollars), most recent year available

field.name: cardiovasc_death_rate
field.description: Share of the population living in extreme poverty, most recent year available since 2010

field.name: diabetes_prevalence
field.description: Death rate from cardiovascular disease in 2017 (annual number of deaths per 100,000 people)

field.name: female_smokers
field.description: Diabetes prevalence (% of population aged 20 to 79) in 2017

field.name: male_smokers
field.description: Share of women who smoke, most recent year available

field.name: handwashing_facilities
field.description: Share of men who smoke, most recent year available

field.name: hospital_beds_per_thousand
field.description: Share of the population with basic handwashing facilities on premises, most recent year available

field.name: life_expectancy
field.description: Hospital beds per 1,000 people, most recent year available since 2010

field.name: human_development_index
field.description: Life expectancy at birth in 2019

field.name: population
field.description: A composite index measuring average achievement in three basic dimensions of human development—a long and healthy life, knowledge and a decent standard of living. Values for 2019, imported from http://hdr.undp.org/en/indicators/137506

field.name: excess_mortality_cumulative_absolute
field.description: Percentage difference between the reported number of weekly or monthly deaths in 2020–2021 and the projected number of deaths for the same period based on previous years. For more information, see https://github.com/owid/covid-19-data/tree/master/public/data/excess_mortality

field.name: excess_mortality_cumulative
field.description: Percentage difference between the cumulative number of deaths since 1 January 2020 and the cumulative projected deaths for the same period based on previous years. For more information, see https://github.com/owid/covid-19-data/tree/master/public/data/excess_mortality

field.name: excess_mortality
field.description: Cumulative difference between the reported number of deaths since 1 January 2020 and the projected number of deaths for the same period based on previous years. For more information, see https://github.com/owid/covid-19-data/tree/master/public/data/excess_mortality

field.name: excess_mortality_cumulative_per_million
field.description: Cumulative difference between the reported number of deaths since 1 January 2020 and the projected number of deaths for the same period based on previous years, per million people. For more information, see https://github.com/owid/covid-19-data/tree/master/public/data/excess_mortality

keywords: subject > health and fitness > health > health conditions > diseases > covid19

name: Our World in Data - COVID-19
description:
# Our World in Data - COVID-19 

---

### ▶ About Our World in Data 🏢
- [Our World in Data website](https://ourworldindata.org/explorers/coronavirus-data-explorer)
- [Our World in Data GitHub](https://github.com/owid/covid-19-data/tree/master/public/data)

### ▶ Similar Datasets 📄
- [COVID-19 World Vaccination Progress](https://www.kaggle.com/gpreda/covid-world-vaccination-progress)
- [The Our World in Data COVID Vaccination Data](https://www.kaggle.com/tunguz/the-our-world-in-data-covid-vaccination-data)
- [Data on COVID-19 (coronavirus)](https://www.kaggle.com/tunguz/data-on-covid19-coronavirus)
- [COVID-19 dataset by Our World in Data](https://www.kaggle.com/bolkonsky/covid19)

### ▶ Context 📝
 The complete COVID-19 dataset is a collection of the COVID-19 data maintained and provided by [Our World in Data](https://ourworldindata.org/explorers/coronavirus-data-explorer). Our World in Data team will update it daily throughout the duration of the COVID-19 pandemic.

### ▶ Content 📃
These are the following information that includes in the dataset:
| Metrics | Source | Updated | Countries |
| --- | --- |
| Vaccinations | Official data collated by the Our World in Data team | Daily | 218 |
| Tests & positivity | Official data collated by the Our World in Data team | Weekly | 139 |
| Hospital & ICU | Official data collated by the Our World in Data team | Weekly | 39 |
| Confirmed cases | JHU CSSE COVID-19 Data | Daily | 196 |
| Confirmed deaths | JHU CSSE COVID-19 Data | Daily | 196 |
| Reproduction rate | Arroyo-Marioli F, Bullano F, Kucinskas S, Rondón-Moreno C | Daily | 185 |
| Policy responses | Oxford COVID-19 Government Response Tracker | Daily | 186 |
| Other variables of interest | International organizations (UN, World Bank, OECD, IHME…) | Fixed |

*Data dictionary is available below ⤵*

### ▶ Acknowledgements 🙏

I'd like to clarify that I'm only making data about vaccines collected by **Our World in Data** available to **Kaggle community**. 
This dataset is gathered, integrated, and posted the new version on a daily basis, as maintained by **Our World in Data** on their [GitHub](https://github.com/owid/covid-19-data/tree/master/public/data) repository.

### ▶ Inspiration 💭

- Forecasting daily new confirmed cases of COVID-19 in specific country.
- Perform data analysis/data visualization of COVID-19 cases/death/etc.

---

📷 *Images by [Fusion Medical Animation](https://unsplash.com/@fusion_medical_animation).*
